understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_metho: The unclear code is a method called prevalentSystem() which checks if a prevalent system is configured and throws an exception if it is not.
understanding.developer_understanding_on_unclear_code_: The unclear code is related to the configuration as it ensures that a prevalent system is properly configured before it is used in the snapshot manager method.

config_description: Cannot found this configuration description for this configuration.
developer_understanding_on_working: The configuration _prevalentSystem is used to initialize the prevalent system in the code. It is passed as a parameter to the GenericSnapshotManager constructor.
developer_understanding_on_triggering_fr: The configuration _prevalentSystem is triggered whenever a new GenericSnapshotManager is created in the code. The frequency of triggering depends on the usage of GenericSnapshotManager in the system.
developer_understanding_on_size_impact: The impact of the _prevalentSystem configuration option is significant as it directly affects the behavior of the GenericSnapshotManager. It determines the prevalent system that will be used by the snapshot manager, which can impact the overall system performance and behavior.
